value.title: Announcing Dart 2 Stable and the Dart Web Platform

content.subtitle: Signals the rebirth of Dart as a mainstream programming language for mobile and web development

paragraphs.name: 05f5
paragraphs.text: Announcing Dart 2 Stable and the Dart Web Platform

paragraphs.name: c9f9
paragraphs.text: Signals the rebirth of Dart as a mainstream programming language for mobile and web development

paragraphs.name: a912
paragraphs.text: Today, we’re announcing the immediate availability of the stable release of Dart 2, including a rewrite of the Dart web platform that offers a unique combination of productivity, performance and scalability.

paragraphs.name: 36d2
paragraphs.text: Flutter developers are already enjoying many of the benefits of Dart 2, since Flutter has been bundling prerelease versions of the Dart 2 SDK for several months. However, the stable release of Dart 2 is another important milestone towards the stable release of Flutter, due to the tight coupling between framework and language. If you haven’t already installed Flutter, start here.

paragraphs.name: c557
paragraphs.text: With the release of Dart 2, web developers can now leverage the same language, libraries and tools along with a number of web-specific enhancements. Web developers should start at the Get Started page for instructions on installing tools and building a first application.

paragraphs.name: f048
paragraphs.text: Dart: Growing Excitement

paragraphs.name: fba0
paragraphs.text: Dart 2 marks the rebirth of Dart as a mainstream programming language focused on enabling a fast development and great user experiences for mobile and web applications. We want to enable developers building client applications to be productive, with a language, framework and components that reduce boilerplate and let them concentrate on the business logic, along with tooling that identifies errors early, enables powerful debugging and delivers small, fast runtime code.

paragraphs.name: 9a5e
paragraphs.text: Over the last year, Dart has seen dramatic growth. Our own analytics suggest a ten-fold growth in external usage. In the last quarter, Dart was one of the fastest growing languages on GitHub, as measured by pull requests; the growth of StackOverflow questions also provides a vivid demonstration of Dart’s momentum:

paragraphs.name: 364d
paragraphs.text: Internally, Dart is one of a handful of languages Google uses for web application development, with millions of lines of code from dozens of different projects including Google Ads, Google Shopping and our own internal infrastructure teams.

paragraphs.name: 1e44
paragraphs.text: In fact, you might already be using Dart without realizing it: the popular Sass stylesheet preprocessor was recently rewritten in Dart to make it faster, more portable, and easier to write. Sass is now distributed as a standalone executable on Homebrew and Chocolatey, and compiled to pure JavaScript on npm. Dart makes it easy to install applications anywhere without external dependencies, and to slot into the workflows of both people who use Dart and people who don’t.

paragraphs.name: 3b51
paragraphs.text: Dart 2 is focused on three areas: strengthening and tightening the language, developing our support for web and mobile frameworks, and bringing some of the tooling and components that support Google’s usage of Dart to the outside world. The rest of this post will explore these themes.

paragraphs.name: 5ee9
paragraphs.text: Dart 2: A Client-Optimized Language

paragraphs.name: 16d0
paragraphs.text: As we highlighted in February, the Dart type system is sound. This means that a large class of issues is found before your users run your application — during analysis and compilation. As we scaled Dart to extremely large apps within Google, the type system caught more errors early in the development cycle, leading to higher quality production code.

paragraphs.name: 97bd
paragraphs.text: With Dart 2, you can’t get into a state where an expression evaluates to a value that doesn’t match the expression’s static type. This means that you can scale your codebase to millions of lines, tackle large refactoring projects, and deploy your code with confidence.

paragraphs.name: bbc3
paragraphs.text: Don’t worry: soundness doesn’t mean mountains of boilerplate. The type system includes advanced inference — even for generic type arguments.

paragraphs.name: f938
paragraphs.text: final _field = [3.14, 6.28];

paragraphs.name: b42d
1c05
fa42
f3b2
paragraphs.text: To learn more about the Dart 2 type system, check out this page.

paragraphs.name: ac9e
paragraphs.text: As mentioned in previous blog posts, Dart 2 also reduces the language ceremony in a few key areas: for example, the new keyword is now optional, and the const keyword is optional within a constant context.

paragraphs.name: bd29
paragraphs.text: Lastly, we’ve done lots of work behind the scenes to unify various supporting tools, with a common front-end that now supports our compilers and runtimes. This ensures consistency for our users now and promises to improve the velocity and quality of new features as Dart continues to evolve.

paragraphs.name: f5fe
paragraphs.text: Dart on the Web: A Rich, Powerful Framework

paragraphs.name: 7f16
paragraphs.text: Web applications have been central to Dart’s mission from the start. In fact, most Dart development at Google is for web applications. One of the biggest is Google Ads, which powers billions of dollars of the web economy. In the process of migrating their code to Dart, they reduced the size of their UI codebase by 40% while improving developer productivity and application quality.

paragraphs.name: 28d2
paragraphs.text: While the core Dart SDK provides libraries to access modern browser APIs, we also support a robust Angular-inspired framework for building complex web applications. AngularDart 5, shipped as part of Dart 2, takes advantage of Dart’s sound type system and the new build system (described below) to offer fast incremental builds during development and smaller compiled JavaScript when you’re ready to deploy.

paragraphs.name: 14f2
paragraphs.text: One major area of focus for this release has been improving the amount of code that is processed on page load, significantly reducing the ‘time to interactivity’ for web pages. Many apps have seen code size reduced by more than half compared to AngularDart 4.

paragraphs.name: c05e
paragraphs.text: To showcase the improvements in Dart’s web platform, we built out a Dart-based client implementation for the HackerNews site as a Progressive Web App; this is published along with other sample implementations at the popular HNPWA site. Using best practices for building Dart web apps, we were able to ship a full-featured experience that is fully interactive in one second on modern devices and under five seconds on a modest mobile device on a slow 3G network. This is competitive even with lightweight web frameworks that are optimized for smaller apps.

paragraphs.name: 368f
paragraphs.text: hnpwa.dartlang.org

paragraphs.name: 1ca5
paragraphs.text: Our framework investments extend to our core components, which we’ve also updated. You now have access to 100 new classes, including a number of date, time, and menu Material components. You can explore all of our components in the component gallery.
Material Date Picker — one of the rich components available for your web application

paragraphs.name: 85db
paragraphs.text: Flexible Tooling for Dart 2

paragraphs.name: 066f
paragraphs.text: With Dart 2, Dart becomes a first-class compiled-to-JavaScript language, with a dev cycle that web developers expect and excellent runtime performance characteristics. This is done while providing benefits most JS-targeted languages don’t provide: a sound type system and excellent support for native mobile apps.

With Dart 2, our web tools embrace a 100% JavaScript development model with two complementary JavaScript compilers. The development compiler, dartdevc, provides fast incremental compilation while generating JavaScript that is easy to read and debug. This allows our production compiler, dart2js, to focus on producing highly optimized JavaScript for progressive web apps for mobile and complex enterprise experiences for the desktop. Both compilers leverage Dart’s sound type system to optimize their output.

paragraphs.name: bb88
paragraphs.text: Our web tools are based on a new build system, designed to be fast, debuggable, and extensible. Now tasks like generating serialization code, compiling Sass to CSS and compiling Dart to JavaScript happen in one toolchain that supports fast, incremental updates as you change parts of your application. The build system is also designed to support uses beyond the web. An example: it’s being used by Flutter developers, to generate JSON serialization code.

paragraphs.name: ab5d
paragraphs.text: With Dart 2, we also have an expanded set of developer tools. In addition to support for Android Studio and the JetBrains suite of tools, including IntelliJ IDEA and WebStorm, we also support Visual Studio Code with the Dart Code extension. And we also have a great scratchpad for experimenting: DartPad, which has been fully updated for Dart 2.

paragraphs.name: 6d97
paragraphs.text: Finally, the Dart SDK comes with a suite of other useful tools: a package manager that works with our package site, a static analyzer, a linter that you can consume from the command line or as a package, and tooling for web documentation and code formatting that conforms with the Dart style guide.

paragraphs.name: 7b93
paragraphs.text: Learn more

paragraphs.name: d6d0
paragraphs.text: Check out the instructions for getting started with Flutter and the Dart web toolset.

paragraphs.name: b67b
paragraphs.text: The release notes provide a detailed technical breakdown of the numerous other smaller improvements made since Dart 1, some of which are breaking changes for older Dart code. If you run into problems that a Google search can’t solve, we recommend starting at StackOverflow. Subscribe to the Dart Announcements mailing list and follow us on Twitter to get updates. We’d also love to see you in our communities, for example the Gitter chat room and r/dartlang subreddit.

paragraphs.name: 6c15
paragraphs.text: Thank you

paragraphs.name: 27b4
paragraphs.text: Dart has become a general purpose language that is optimized for web and mobile development. We’ve been working on Dart 2 for several years, during which time it has touched every aspect of our ecosystem and required migrating millions of lines of code and hundreds of packages.

paragraphs.name: f582
paragraphs.text: We are grateful to the Dart and Flutter communities and well as the hundreds of Google engineers who have helped us on this journey. We couldn’t have done it without you!
